intro: Specklinia ciliolata, commonly known as the feather-leaf lithops, is a species of flowering plant in the Aizoaceae family. It is native to South Africa, specifically the Western Cape Province, where it grows in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that are covered in fine, hair-like structures, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the winter months. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is often cultivated as a succulent for its ornamental value.
